Chidekgre Sunset View Point – A Hidden Jewel in NatureJoin our travel community for the latest tips, guides, and exclusive offers!Subscribe You have already subscribed our newsletter!Thanks for Subscribing our newsletter!Imagine standing on a hilltop, surrounded by lush green landscapes, as the golden sun slowly dips behind the horizon. The skies light up with shades of orange, pink, and purple—it’s a sight straight out of a dream! If you’re planning a Meghalaya holiday, chasing sunsets here should be on your bucket list. For this, we have got a list of the best Sunset Points in Meghalaya for you! From scenic lakeside to majestic hilltops, this enchanting state offers magical places to watch the sun bid the world goodnight, making it one of the best things to do in Meghalaya.Ready to discover these jaw-dropping sunset points in Meghalaya? Let’s take you on a journey filled with breathtaking views and unforgettable moments with the best places to watch a sunset in Meghalaya.12 Best Sunset Spots in Meghalaya1. Umiam Lake – A Peaceful Sunset by the WaterAs the sun begins to set, Umiam Lake transforms into a canvas of shimmering gold and orange. The calm waters mirror the sky’s hues, turning into a glittering sheet of yellow and red. Gentle ripples spread across the lake as if nature itself is painting a masterpiece. Surrounded by pine-covered hills, this Meghalaya sunset spot is peaceful and picture-perfect, making it one of the most beautiful sunset points in Meghalaya. Whether you sit quietly by the shore or take a boat ride, the experience is unforgettable.Location: MV2V+FJF, National Highway 40, Shillong, Umiam, Meghalaya 793016Other Activities to Do Around Umiam Lake:Boating on the lakePicnicking by the lush green banksTrekking around nearby trailsWatching birds in the picturesque surroundings2. Laitlum Canyon – Sunset from the Edge of the WorldStanding at the edge of Laitlum Canyon feels like being on top of the world. As the sun begins to sink, the vast valley below glows with warm orange and golden hues. The sky changes colors dramatically, and shadows stretch across the rugged cliffs. The gentle breeze brushes past your face as you watch the enchanting scene unfold. This peaceful spot is one of the most scenic sunset points in Meghalaya and a must-visit for nature lovers. The vast plateau above the canyons is a perfect vantage point to watch the best sunsets in Meghalaya.Location: CWX5+GHH, Laitlum, Meghalaya 793015Other Activities to Do Around Laitlum Canyon:Trekking along the scenic trailsVisiting Rasong village nearbyBird watching and photographyEnjoying a peaceful picnic3. Sunset View Point, Darechikgre – A Hidden Gem in TuraDarechikgre Meghalaya Sunset Point is one of the best places to watch a sunset in Tura. This offbeat gem of Meghalaya is easily accessible as it is located along a highway. All you have to do is park your vehicle, walk a few steps towards the edge and wait for the sunset magic.At Darechikgre’s Sunset View Point, time seems to slow down. The setting sun casts golden and pink hues across the sky, while the vast expanse of lush forests turns dark green as evening approaches. Gentle mist often rolls over the distant hills, making the scene even more magical. Watching this view feels like stepping into a nature painting, making it one of the most peaceful sunset spots in Meghalaya.Location: G7Q3+48J, Dachimagre, Meghalaya 794001Other Activities to Do Around Darechikgre:Trekking to Tura PeakExploring Nokrek National ParkVisiting nearby villagesEnjoying local food and culture4. Mawlynnong – Best Sunset from the Bamboo Sky ViewpointMawlynnong the cleanest village in Asia is one of the best places to watch a sunset in Meghalaya. This clean village appears straight out of a movie as the sun casts its golden glow in the evening. The Bamboo Skydeck built by the locals on a tree is a perfect front-row seat to one of nature’s grand shows. Below you, the green treetops stretch endlessly, while the horizon glows with soft hues of orange and pink. As the sun disappears behind the hills, the entire landscape is bathed in golden light. The fresh air and peaceful vibe make it one of the most enchanting sunset viewpoints in Meghalaya. This is the perfect place to admire the peaceful sunsets in Meghalaya.Location: 6W27+HJR, Mawlynnong, Meghalaya 793109Other Activities to Do Around Mawlynnong:Exploring the Living Root BridgeStrolling through the clean village lanesHiking in the lush forestsVisiting the Balancing Rock5. Nohkalikai Falls – A Majestic Sunset Over India’s Tallest Plunge WaterfallAs the golden sun sinks lower in the sky, Nohkalikai Falls becomes a magical sight. The waterfall, one of the tallest in India, glows under the warm hues of the sunset. The crystal-clear water plunges from a towering cliff into a turquoise pool below, creating a misty veil that sparkles in the fading sunlight. The lush green cliffs surrounding the fall look even more vibrant at dusk, making this one of the most stunning sunset points in Meghalaya. Don’t forget your camera because every second of this view is unforgettable. Without a doubt, it is one of the best places for a sunset in Cherrapunji.Location: 7MCQ+GXC, Nohkalikai Rd., Cherrapunji, Meghalaya 793108Other Activities to Do Around Nohkalikai Falls:Trekking to nearby viewpointsVisiting local villagesExploring Cherrapunji’s cavesEnjoying local food at roadside stalls6. Umngot River, Dawki – A Crystal-Clear Sunset by the RiverThe Umngot River in Dawki is famous for its clear waters, where boats look like they’re floating on air. During Meghalaya sunset hours, the river turns into a shimmering sheet of gold and orange as the last light of day reflects on its glassy surface. The surrounding hills and greenery bathe in soft hues of yellow, creating a peaceful scene. Watching a sunset in Dawki is a magical experience that feels straight out of a dream, making it one of the best sunset spots in Meghalaya.Location: Dawki, Meghalaya 793109Other Activities to Do Around Umngot River:Boating on the crystal-clear watersCamping by the Dawki RiversideFishing with localsExploring the India-Bangladesh border7. Shillong Peak – A Panoramic Sunset Over the CityStanding at Shillong Peak gives you a bird’s-eye view of the city and its surrounding hills, making it a top place for a sunset in Shillong. As the sun begins to set, the landscape below is painted in shades of gold and pink. The city lights start to twinkle in the distance while the sky puts on its evening show. A gentle breeze brushes past, adding to the magical vibe. It’s no surprise that this is one of the top places to watch a sunset in Meghalaya. Make sure to visit on a clear day for the best view of sunset in Shillong.Location: Peak Viewing Point, Shillong, Meghalaya 793004Other Activities to Do Around Shillong Peak:Hiking around the peakVisiting Air Force MuseumBirdwatching in the forested areaExploring local markets in Shillong8. Daithlen Falls – For a Scenic Sunset in CherrapunjiDaithlen Falls is surrounded by green valleys and rocky cliffs, making it a picturesque spot to watch sunsets in Meghalaya. As the golden light falls on the cascading water, it sparkles like liquid gold. The sound of this waterfall in Cherrapunji combined with the vibrant colors of the sky creates a calming atmosphere. This hidden gem is one of the most peaceful sunset points in Meghalaya for those who love nature’s beauty.Location: 7MVM+99G, Dainthlen Road, Cherrapunji, Meghalaya 793111Other Activities to Do Around Daithlen Falls:Hiking along the rocky pathsExploring nearby cavesPicnicking by the waterfallVisiting Cherrapunji’s viewpoints9. Mawphanlur Lake – A Serene Sunset Amid Rolling HillsMawphanlur Lake located on the hilltop village of Mawphanlur feels like stepping into a peaceful dream. As the sun sets, the gentle ripples on the lake turn golden, reflecting the warm hues of the sky. Surrounded by green rolling hills, this sunset spots in Meghalaya becomes even more magical with the fading light. The calm atmosphere and untouched beauty make it one of the most peaceful places to watch a sunsets in Meghalaya. It’s perfect for travelers looking to unwind in nature’s lap.Location: GCVM+J69, Ki Pung Mawthadraishan,, Meghalaya 793119Other Activities to Do Around Mawphanlur Lake:Boating on the lakeHiking around the lush hillsBirdwatching in the surroundingsCamping under the starry sky10. Mawkdok Dympep Valley Viewpoint – A Stunning Canyon SunsetMawkdok Dympep Valley Sunset Viewpoints in Meghalaya offer a breathtaking view of the deep, green valley below. During Meghalaya sunset hours, the entire landscape glows under shades of orange and pink, creating a picture-perfect scene. The views of the mist-covered cliffs from Mawkdok Dympep Valley Viewpoint look even more enchanting as the sun dips lower into the horizon. This is undoubtedly one of the best sunset spots in Meghalaya, ideal for travelers seeking natural beauty.Location: Mawkdok, Meghalaya 793111Other Activities to Do Around Mawkdok Dympep Valley:Ziplining across the valleyHiking on nearby trailsEnjoying snacks at local stallsPhotography from the viewpoint11. Tura Peak – A Sunset in Tura Above the CloudsTura Peak is a hidden gem where the sunset feels like magic unfolding right before your eyes. Standing at the top, you can see endless layers of hills blanketed by mist as the sky lights up with shades of orange and pink, making it one of the best sunset points in Meghalaya.Sometimes, the clouds seem to float right beneath your feet. It’s one of the best sunset viewpoints in Meghalaya, offering a quiet escape for those who love scenic landscapes. Tura Peak is also one of the best places to visit in the Garo hills of Meghalaya.Location: G64G+P42, Akonggre, Tura, Meghalaya 794001Other Activities to Do Around Tura Peak:Trekking through forest trailsExploring Nokrek National Park in MeghalayaBirdwatchingVisiting nearby villages12. Chidekgre Sunset View Point – A Hidden Jewel in NatureChidekgre Sunset View Point is one of the top places to watch a sunset in Meghalaya. It is tucked away in serene surroundings, offering a peaceful escape from the busy world. As the sun sinks lower, the sky turns into a beautiful blend of gold, pink, and purple. The view stretches over lush green landscapes, and a gentle mist often adds a dreamy touch to the scene. This tranquil spot is one of the most delightful sunset points in Meghalaya, perfect for nature lovers.Location: Rongreng Chidekgre, Williamnagar, Meghalaya 794111Other Activities to Do Around Chidekgre:Trekking through scenic pathsExploring Chidekgre villageVisiting local plantationsEnjoying a picnic amidst natureGet exclusive travel insights & updates into your inbox!Subscribe *By clicking subscribe you'll receive emails from WanderOn.You have already subscribed our newsletter!Thanks for Subscribing our newsletter!Shrutika Parab★★★★★24 May 2024“Thank you Team Wanderon for the amazing Ladakh Experience.
